name: Indian-Style Salmon Fry
author: Fran
summary: My mother used to make a simplified version of this that got me through my broke years in college. I've become a big fan of Indian food, so I 'Indianed' up this old favorite. You can tone down the heat by removing the seeds from the chili pepper. Serve it with rice.
ingredients: 1 small onion, sliced into thin half-circles
2 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and bones removed
directions: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; place the cumin and mustard seeds in the hot oil and cook until the seeds begin to pop
Cook and stir the onions in the spice mixture until they brown
Mix in the garlic, ginger, chile pepper, and curry leaves; cook and stir until the garlic becomes golden

Add the tomatoes and stir for a few seconds before adding the salmon, using the back of your stirring spoon to break the salmon into small pieces in the pan; cook until the salmon is heated through, 5 to 10 minutes; remove from heat
